title: Newtons second law-box pulled up an inclined ramp

content.question: A person exerts a force <math alttext="F sub p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>p</mi></msub></math> on a rope to pull a block of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> up a ramp. The rope makes an angle <math alttext="theta sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> to the ramp and the ramp makes an angle <math alttext="theta sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> to the horizontal, as shown. The force of kinetic friction between the block and the ramp has magnitude <math alttext="F sub lowercase f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math>. Which of the following expressions is equal to the magnitude of the acceleration <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>a</mi></math> of the block?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator F sub p, end sub, times the cosine of theta sub 2, end sub, plus F sub lowercase f, and denominator m, end fraction, minus g times the sine of theta sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>p</mi></msub><mi>cos</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></mrow><mi>m</mi></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mi>g</mi><mi>sin</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator F sub p, end sub, times the cosine of theta sub 2, end sub, minus F sub lowercase f, and denominator m, end fraction, minus g times the sine of theta sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>p</mi></msub><mi>cos</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></mrow><mi>m</mi></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mi>g</mi><mi>sin</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator F sub p, end sub, times the cosine of theta sub 2, end sub, plus F sub lowercase f, and denominator m, end fraction, plus g times the sine of theta sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>p</mi></msub><mi>cos</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></mrow><mi>m</mi></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mi>g</mi><mi>sin</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator F sub p, end sub, times the cosine of theta sub 2, end sub, minus F sub lowercase f, and denominator m, end fraction, plus g times the sine of theta sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>p</mi></msub><mi>cos</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></mrow><mi>m</mi></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mi>g</mi><mi>sin</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator F sub p, end sub, times the cosine of theta sub 2, end sub, minus F sub lowercase f, and denominator m, end fraction, minus g times the sine of theta sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>p</mi></msub><mi>cos</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></mrow><mi>m</mi></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mi>g</mi><mi>sin</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
